etymology.description: Depicts a hand holding a drumstick
etymology.interpretation: The character 支(支) (zhī, 'hand holding drumstick') visually represents a hand grasping a stick-like object, suggesting support or physical action, which aligns with its meanings related to branching or supporting.

examples.chinese: 他支鼓槌(他支鼓槌)，敲响大鼓(敲響大鼓)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhī gǔchuí, qiāo xiǎng dà gǔ.
examples.english: He holds the drumstick and strikes the big drum.

examples.chinese: 鼓手支着鼓槌(鼓手支著鼓槌)，打出动人节奏(打出動人節奏)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔshǒu zhī zhe gǔchuí, dǎ chū dòngrén jiézòu.
examples.english: The drummer holds the drumstick and produces a captivating rhythm.
